The claim was debunked by the Alabama Se: s office, which stated that they had received no reports of voters in the special Senate election caught voting multiple times with fake IDs.
The Alabama Secretary of State: s office confirmed that there was no significant scale of voter fraud reported in Birmingham, the area mentioned in the claim.
The Federal Election Commission: FEC) does not have jurisdiction over voting irregularities in statewide elections, contradicting the claim that the FEC had announced the possible invalidation of 60,000 votes.
